contentList.content:
Blade cantrips do not stack with Extra Attack.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.

The bonus on hit damage starts at 0 and increases by [1] every 5 levels.

Blade cantrips do not stack with Extra Attack.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.

The bonus on hit damage starts at 0 and increases by [1] every 5 levels.
Attack the target dealing a bonus [1]. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread green-flame to burn another nearby creature for [2].

Invoking the Bladesong. You gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> is increased by [2]. You also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> in Acrobatics and a +[1] bonus to Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.

This reaction won't trigger on a Critical Hit.

Cannot be stacked with Green-Flame Blade.

Bladesinging impeded by a shield. Until the shield is removed, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLADESONG">Bladesong</LSTag> won't grant any benefits or let you generate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLADESONG_TECHINCAL">Bladesong Charges</LSTag>.
Spend a superiority die to make an attack that deals an additional [1] damage and possibly knocks the target <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
You can't use this attack if you have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
The target must be Large or smaller.
All the time spent practicing with blades, spells and sleight of hand has paid off. You gain an additional bonus action.

Invoke the Bladesong. You gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> increases by [2]. You also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> in Acrobatics and a +[1] bonus to Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Can only use Booming Blade once per action.

Blade cantrips do not stack with Extra Attack.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.

The bonus on hit damage starts at 0 and increases by [1] every 5 levels.
Also works if you have an ally within [1] of the target or there is no one but you and the target within [1] but for both you can't have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

You also unlock <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Bladesong_Finisher">Bladesong Climax</LSTag> and the ability to accumulate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLADESONG_TECHINCAL">Bladesong Charges</LSTag> in combat.

Bladesinging impeded by armour. Until the armour is removed, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLADESONG">Bladesong</LSTag> won't grant any benefits or let you generate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLADESONG_TECHINCAL">Bladesong Charges</LSTag>.

This reaction will trigger on a Critical Hit.

Cannot be stacked with Booming Blade.
Attack an enemy moving out of your reach.
Strike the target dealing a bonus [1]. If the attack lands, the target is sheathed in booming energy that deals [2] to them if they willingly move.

Blade cantrips do not stack with Extra Attack.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.

The bonus on hit damage starts at 0 and increases by [1] every 5 levels.

Requires the ability to Sneak Attack (Melee).
Strike the target dealing a bonus [1]. If the attack lands, the target is sheathed in booming energy that deals [2] to them if they willingly move.

This reaction will trigger on a Critical Hit.

Cannot be stacked with Green-Flame Blade.
Deal a bonus [1] to the target. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread green flames to burn another for [2].
You can't use this attack if you have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
You can use both your action and bonus action on a turn to attack a target with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> and deal an additional [1] damage.

A charge that will increase how much damage you deal to enemies by [1] when using Bladesong Climax.

You can accumulate these charges by casting Level 1 spells or above that are not weapon attacks.

This reaction won't trigger on a Critical Hit.

Cannot be stacked with Booming Blade.
When you take the Dash Action, your Speed increases by [1] for that action.
This effect still works if your attack misses.
Can only use Green-Flame Blade once per action.
You can't use this attack if you have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Also works if you have an ally within [1] of the target or there is no one but you and the target within [1] but for both you can't have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Attack the target dealing a bonus [1]. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread green-flame to burn another nearby creature for [2].
Your hands have become infused with the weave and anticipate your movements. You gain an additional action.

Blade cantrips do not stack with Extra Attack.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.

The bonus on hit damage starts at 0 and increases by [1] every 5 levels.
If you move after making a melee attack, you don't provoke <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag> from your target.
Spend a superiority die to make an attack that deals an additional [1] damage and possibly forces the target to drop the weapons they are holding.
Swing your weapon in a rapid, sweeping arc to attack multiple enemies at once. Roll your superiority die for damage.
Can burn a nearby enemy with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_GreenFlameBladeExtra">Spread Green Flame Blade</LSTag>. Removed if you move.
You gain an additional way to use your Sneak Attack; You can now also perform sneak attacks if there are no other enemies within 5 feet of the target (the enemy is isolated).

your confidence propels you into battle. You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>

A charge that will increase how much you heal yourself and your allies by [1] when using Bladesong Climax.

You can accumulate these charges by attacking with weapons.

Bladesinging impeded by a weapon. Until the weapon is removed, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLADESONG">Bladesong</LSTag> won't grant any benefits or let you generate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLADESONG_TECHINCAL">Bladesong Charges</LSTag>.

Unleash the full damaging and healing effects of your Bladesong at once. Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLADESONG_DAMAGE_CHARGE">Bladesong Damage Charges</LSTag> will harm enemies an additional [1], and your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLADESONG_HEALING_CHARGE">Bladesong Healing Charges</LSTag> will heal you and your allies an additional [2].
Cannot be targeted by <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_GreenFlameBladeExtra">Spread Green Flame Blade</LSTag>.
Strike the target dealing a bonus [1]. If the attack lands, the target is sheathed in booming energy that deals [2] to them if they willingly move.

Bladesinging impeded due to being unarmed. Until a valid weapon is equipped, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLADESONG">Bladesong</LSTag> won't grant any benefits or let you generate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLADESONG_TECHINCAL">Bladesong Charges</LSTag>.
This will end your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLADESONG">Bladesong</LSTag>.

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> with Light Armour and in the Performance skill. You also gain Proficiency with Daggers, Sickles, Shortswords, Rapiers, Scimitars, and Longswords.

<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DISTRACTED">Distract</LSTag> your target, giving your allies <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on their next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against the target.

Blade cantrips do not stack with Extra Attack.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.

The bonus on hit damage starts at 0 and increases by [1] every 5 levels.

Requires the ability to Sneak Attack (Melee).
Also works if you have an ally within [1] of the target or there is no one but you and within [1] of the target. However you can't have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Can only cast Booming Blade or Green-Flame Blade once per action.
